alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 05 at 3:15PM AKST until January 06 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills 40 to 50 below occuring. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Deltana and Tanana Flats. * WHEN...Now to noon Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...East winds winds of 25 to 40 mph are causing wind chills to 50 below. Blowing and drifting snow is possible as well. Conditions will improve Thursday afternoon as winds decrease. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.
